text: [Music]
those war of words continued between two
old folks as the US imposes new
sanctions on Russia over its actions in
Ukraine meanwhile President Obama has
been criticized for not doing enough but
foreign policy is often driven by public
opinion
so what's America's take it turns out
over half of Americans support amping up
those sanctions against Russia that's
according to a new survey by the Pew
Research Center in USA Today but maybe
the buck stops there only 1/3 think it'd
be a good idea to send arms and military
supplies to Ukraine now ultimately that
may be President Obama's call and his
grades through all this are only so-so
just four and ten Americans think his
handling of the crisis has been about
right regardless of who does what and
how do Americans think it matters well
not really only about a third of the
country thinks what happens between
Russia and Ukraine is very important to
the u.s. which sort of makes sense if we
take a look at a survey published by The
Washington Post a few weeks ago
political scientists found that only one
in six Americans could actually find
Ukraine on a map the median response was
about 2900 kilometers off the survey
actually found that the less accurate a
person was about Ukraine's location the
more they wanted the US military to get
involved
David Botti BBC News Washington
you
